scenarioDescription:
The K2-247 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-247 is a star with 0.74 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.69 times its radius. It is located 841.85 light years away from the solar system.

K2-247 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-247 system


K2-247 b

K2-247 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-247 b is 5.152 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-247 b is 2.120 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-247 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


K2-247 c

K2-247 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-247 c is 5.438 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-247 c is 2.190 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-247 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-247, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-247 - System With 2 Exoplanets
